postTreatment.subtitle: 12 weeks after surgery Compression garment (day and night).

general.title: Allgemeines zum Brazilian Butt-Lift
general.content: Although the aesthetics of the buttocks still lag behind the status of the female breast in Germany, in comparison to countries like Brazil or the USA, buttock corrections are becoming increasingly popular. An autologous fat injection to contour and enlarge the buttocks is currently considered the most effective method in the field of buttock shaping, with the fewest complications.

engagement.title: Der Eingriff
engagement.content:
The Brazilian Butt Lift is a two-part treatment that can take up to four hours in total. Depending on the extent of the procedure or the amount of autologous fat removed, the duration of the operation may increase. The procedure is performed under general anaesthesia as no local anaesthetic should be used during the extraction of autologous fat in order not to additionally damage the very sensitive fat cells and thus achieve an optimal result. Before the operation begins, the patient can have a detailed discussion with the surgeon and the anaesthetist to clarify any final questions.
In the course of the procedure, the fat, that is needed to increase the volume of the buttocks, is first suctioned out. This is usually done using the tumescent technique, which involves injecting a fluid into the donor areas before the suction process, that loosens the fatty tissue. Now its possible to gently harvest the fat without damaging the surrounding tissue, i.e. veins, vessels and nerves, which is then specially prepared for lipofilling.
 Using fine cannulas, the extracted fatty tissue is transplanted specifically and evenly into the buttock region until the desired shape and size is achieved. The injection sites are closed with a mini-suture.

content.title: How do I prepare for the operation?
content.subtitle:
You should have reached your target weight and keep it constant. To ensure that there are enough fat deposits on the body, a high-calorie diet is recommended before the operation.
At the latest two weeks before the operation, anticoagulant and blood-thinning medication should be discontinued. This also applies to some over-the-counter preparations such as aspirin.

content.title: Hospital stay
content.subtitle: 1-3 days inpatient

content.title: What happens after the operation?
content.subtitle: Already in the operating theatre or immediately after the treatment, the patient is put on compression pants, which must be weared for about 12 weeks. It is very important to keep the sleeping position on the stomach for the next 2 to 3 weeks. In this respect, one should also take a 14-days break from work and allow the body plenty of rest to recover.

content.title: What complications can arise?
content.subtitle: Risks and complications of buttock augmentation with autologous fat can never be completely excluded, but they are almost always very low. Typical side effects of a Brazilian Butt Lift include swelling in the recipient area and bruising in the respective donor area, but these will recede or disappear over time. After 12 weeks, the traces of liposuction and fat injection sites should have disappeared.

content.title: What should be considered after the procedure?
content.subtitle: The healing process of the fat takes place during the first 2 weeks. During this sensitive period, special care should be taken to exert as little pressure as possible on the treated buttock area. I.e. also reduce lying on the back and sitting to a minimum during the day, ideally no longer than one hour, in order to keep pressure loads as low as possible.

general.title: Allgemeines zur Faltenbehandlung
general.content:
Unfortunately, no one escapes the genetic ageing process. In the course of life, wrinkles and signs of ageing appear, especially on the face, due to various influencing factors. A distinction is made between mimic and static wrinkles. Mimic wrinkles are caused by a muscle pull under the skin, e.g. frown lines and laugh lines. A permanent pull of the muscles over years thus causes corresponding wrinkles, which even persist from a certain point onwards if no facial mimicry is carried out. 
Age-related or static wrinkles, on the other hand, are caused by loss and displacement of the fat pads in the face. In addition, there is a loss of elastin and collagen fibres in the subcutaneous tissue.
These only produce new fibres at a slower rate in old age and slacken over time. Furthermore, the quality of the collagen and elastin fibres is no longer as high and durable as it was in youth, so that in the long run there is a loss of these fibres.
Other external factors such as sunlight, heat and cold, injuries, stress, smoking etc. have a negative effect on the longevity of the collagen fibres. Natural skin ageing is therefore nothing more than a disturbance of a dynamic balance between the breakdown and new production of elastin and collagen fibres, as well as a redistribution of the fat pads in the face.

treatment.title: Die Behandlung
treatment.content: Various methods are available for the treatment of wrinkles. Wrinkle depth, localisation and skin condition are just some of the factors that must be taken into consideration when choosing the suitable method. All procedures have in common that an optical skin rejuvenation can be achieved by external applications without skin incisions. Here are only mentioned procedures that have proven their effectiveness and low risk over the years.

sub.title: Chemical Peeling
sub.content:
Chemical peeling is a chemically induced peeling treatment of the skin. This local method is used to remove small wrinkles, cornifications or even superficial pigment spots, such as the so-called age spots. It is also suitable for improving the appearance of acne scars. When performed professionally, medical peeling can optically rejuvenate the sun-damaged face, which has been pre-aged by wind and weather, by years.
Depending on the intended skin depth, different substances are used. The most common are vitamin A acid, glycolic acid, trichloroacetic acid and phenol, which is particularly effective. The use of peeling substances, especially phenol, should only be reserved for experienced practitioners, as there are several special points to be considered beforehand. In contrast to dermabrasion, the abrasion of the skin, the extent of which can be precisely determined by the surgeon himself, the depth of penetration of the peeling substances depends on various factors. This can result in deeper layers of skin being unintentionally affected, which would result in undesirable scarring. Basically, the procedure begins with a careful cleansing and degreasing of the skin. The solution is always applied at the lowest concentration for the first application. The patient then feels a rapid onset of action with a slight burning sensation and warmth on the skin. After several applications, a milky coating finally forms. This desired effect is thus achieved and the process is finished. In the following time, a rejection of the superficial skin layers becomes apparent. This exfoliation is completed after about 12 weeks, leaving behind rosy, fresh, and smooth skin. After each peeling procedure, it is important to consistently apply cream to the treated areas and protect them with a hypoallergenic sunscreen. Without proper protection, sunbathing is not allowed before six months have passed.

sub.title: Skin Abrasion
sub.content:
As already mentioned, minor wrinkles or skin irregularities can be removed not only chemically, but also mechanically by means of dermabrasion. During this high-speed abrasion with diamond-coated abrasive heads, it is important to remove the skin as evenly as possible so that a smooth, new surface can form. If the abrasion is too superficial, the desired effect of smoothing wrinkles will not be achieved. If, on the other hand, the abrasion is too deep, the skin reacts with scarring, just as with any other deeper injury. Here, too, it is clear that this otherwise relatively simple and low-risk procedure should only be carried out by an experienced practitioner.
After dermabrasion, the wound surface is generally covered with a scab within 2 days, which detaches and spontaneously rejects after about 8-10 days. After complete shedding, a delicate pink skin is revealed, which is still extremely sensitive in the beginning. Aftercare of the smooth skin is also very important here, as with the peeling procedure. Cosmetic creams or make-up are allowed after 2 weeks at the earliest, and the already mentioned instructions regarding UV exposure should also be followed for at least half a year.

sub.title: Laser
sub.content:
The application areas of lasers used in cosmetics are almost identical to those of peeling and dermabrasion. The domain of the so-called "skin-resurfacing" are the fine (intradermal) wrinkles and texture changes of the ageing skin, which can hardly be repaired during a face-lift.
The technical prerequisite for a positive effect of this treatment method is a sufficiently high energy output of the laser in a very short time, so that the skin does not burn itself but vaporises directly. The ERBIUM-YAG laser, for example, is used for this purpose. In addition to its precise skin ablation, another effect occurs (the so-called "shrinking"). In addition to the regeneration of the upper skin layers, the collagen connective tissue is restructured. The result is a tightening of the entire treatment area.
As with dermabrasion, scab formation also occurs in the first few days after the treatment. The detachment of the scab is completed after approx. 5-7 days, whereby a special treatment with panthenol ointments is recommended. Any residual reddening that initially remains generally subsides completely within 2-3 months, although strict UV protection must also be observed here to avoid staining. Should a new treatment be necessary after about 3-5 years, this is possible without any problems.

content.title: Wann ist eine Faltenbehandlung sinnvoll?
content.subtitle: Eine Faltenbehandlung lohnt sich bereits schon, wenn Sie erste Anzeichen von Falten oder Veränderungen in Ihrem Gesicht bemerken. Das ist keinesfalls altersabhängig und kann sogar schon vor dem 30. Lebensjahr zu tollen Ergebnissen führen. Dabei können wir sowohl die statischen als auch die dynamischen Falten wahlweise mittels Botulinumtoxin (Botox) oder auch Hyaluronsäure behandeln. Welchen Effekt Sie für welche Zeit erwarten können, schildern wir Ihnen in einem ausführlichen Beratungsgespräch.

content.title: Handelt es sich bei einer Faltenbehandlung um einen klassischen schönheitschirurgischen Eingriff?
content.subtitle: Faltenbehandlungen werden heutzutage von einigen Fachrichtungen durchgeführt, so können auch Dermatologen (Hautärzte) etc. diese Behandlungen durchführen. Von welcher Fachrichtung auch immer ausgeführt- Faltenunterspritzungen sind eine sehr nachgefragte Behandlung und werden immer beliebter.

content.title: Wer darf Faltenbehandlungen überhaupt durchführen (Arzt/Kosmetiker)
content.subtitle:
Faltenbehandlungen sowohl mit Botox als auch Hyaluronsäure dürfen rein rechtlich nur approbierte Ärzte jeglicher Fachrichtung durchführen. Diese Eingriffe sind als Injektionen zu werten und demnach nur in erfahrene Hände zu geben.
 Es sind jedoch auch Kosmetiker/-innen auf dem Markt, welche diese Injektionen durchführen. Sie sollten sich bei der Auswahl jedoch auf die jeweilige Erfahrung und den Wohlfühlfaktor verlassen und Ihre Wahl entsprechend treffen.

content.title: Können einzelne Gesichts- und Körperpartien behandelt werden?
content.subtitle: Es können sowohl einzelne Gesichts- als auch Körperpartien behandelt werden. Dabei ist es je nach Areal und Wunsch wichtig, das richtige Präparat für den gewünschten Effekt zu wählen. Wir arbeiten in unseren Praxen in Berlin und Köln mit sehr hochwertigen Partnern zusammen und können Ihnen somit qualitativ hochwertige Produkte für jegliche Indikation anbieten.

content.title: Welche Art von Falten können behandelt werden?
content.subtitle:
Das Falten unterschiedlich entstehen, empfiehlt es sich diese auch unterschiedlich anzugehen. Daher können dynamische Falten im Bereich der Stirn und der Zornesfalte aber auch im Bereich der Krähenfüße wunderbar mittels Botulinumtoxin behandelt werden. Durch eine Blockade der neuromuskulären Übertragung werden die für die Falten verantwortlichen Muskeln gelähmt und somit wird der Faltenwurf verhindert. Sicherlich verändert sich dadurch auch geringfügig Ihre Mimik, so können Sie z.B. je nach Anwendungszone nicht mehr die Stirn runzeln, nicht mehr zornig schauen etc.. Die Wirkung lässt nach 3-6 Monaten nach und die Falten kommen leider wieder.
 Andere Falten (z.B. Nasolabialfalten) verstehen sich heute als eine generelle Veränderung im Gesicht, was durch das Herabsacken verschiedener Fettdepots im Wangenbereich geschieht. Hierbei erfolgt das Unterspritzen der Falten multidimensional, das heißt es erfolgt eine Analyse des gesamten Gesichtes um die Ursache von entsprechenden Falten zu finden. Durch unsere Erfahrung können wir Ihnen im Beratungsgespräch unsere Empfehlung gern aussprechen und Sie dementsprechend behandeln.

content.title: Sehe ich danach wirklich jünger und die Haut straffer aus?
content.subtitle: Je nachdem, welche Behandlung durchgeführt wird und welche Materialien benutzt werden, sieht idealerweise das gesamte Erscheinungsbild frischer aus. Unser Ziel ist es Sie natürlich zu verjüngen, daher legen wir viel Wert auf eine professionelle Unterspritzung mit hochwertigen Materialien. Je nach Wunsch und auch Ausmaß der bestehenden Faltensituation sind teilweise auch mehrere Sitzungen notwendig, um das gewünschte Ziel zu erreichen. Wir beraten Sie vor jeder Behandlung sehr ausführlich und zeigen Ihnen unsere Möglichkeiten mit verschiedenen Präparaten auf.

duration.title: Treatment duration
duration.detail: 30 minutes to 1 hour, depending on the treatment.

areasOfApplication.title: Areas of application
areasOfApplication.detail: Face | Neck | Décolleté | Arms and legs |

general.title: Wringkle Injection
general.content:
The implantation of biomaterials can be described as a milestone in the treatment of wrinkles. The aesthetic results are impressive and speak for themselves. The injection requires a precise indication, as only certain wrinkle formations are suitable for this therapy. First and foremost, the mouth area and the nasolabial folds should be mentioned.
Various materials are available on the market. It should be emphasised that we only use harmless preparations that are not hazardous to health. We do not use any products of animal origin, such as collagen. Instead, we prefer purely synthetically produced substances, such as hyaluronic acid, which, due to the lack of protein components, do not require allergy testing in advance and are characterised by excellent tissue compatibility. By this means, we can look back on a complication-free application with convincing satisfaction among our patients in the past years. However, the exact injection technique is an absolute prerequisite for an even leveling of the skin. In the case of so-called absorbable substances, repetitions are usually necessary, as the relining effect can diminish after about half a year due to degradation processes in the tissue. The use of preparations with a permanent effect is no longer recommended due to a very high complication rate.

treatment.title: Die Behandlung
treatment.content:
Various methods are available for the treatment of wrinkles. Wrinkle depth, localisation and skin condition are only some of the factors that must be taken into consideration when choosing the suitable method. All procedures have in common that an optical skin rejuvenation can be achieved by external applications without skin incisions. Only the methods, that have proven their effectiveness and low risk over the years, are mentioned below.
The various treatment methods differ according to the technique, the material and of course the localisation of the desired injection. After an analysis of your entire face, we will explain to you exactly in which areas of your face injections will lead to which results.

sub.title: Fat injection (Lipofilling)
sub.content: In recent years, alternative procedures to foreign material injections have been developed. The most euphoric response for wrinkle relining is using the body's own fat. However, this method could only partially fulfil expectations. The most convincing advantage of autologous fat injection is that it can be applied over a large area and is relatively easy to obtain from the body's own depots. In an operation (under general or local anaesthesia), your fat is extracted from the appropriate depots, specially and elaborately processed, and then injected into your face. Own fat not only has volume-giving properties but also has a skin-refreshing or rejuvenating effect due to the stem cells and growth factors. The grown and transplanted own fat lasts permanently and is subject to your weight fluctuations as well as your skin ageing. The decisive disadvantage, however, is the high resorption rate. Since only a small part of each fat transplant is connected to the blood supply of the recipient area, up to 60% of the transported fat cells are resorbed within only 2-3 months.

sub.title: Botulinum toxin
sub.content:
The treatment of wrinkles in the forehead region (frown lines) and the laugh lines around the eyes (crow's feet) is facing serious competition since the rediscovery of an old top medical product. The active ingredient of this preparation, botulinum toxin, is a neurotoxin from neurology that had been tried and tested for decades and has found its way into cosmetic surgery due to its wrinkle-smoothing effect. Here a harmless, extremely effective application is guaranteed when used professionally, as a clearly visible rejuvenation and harmonisation of the facial features can be achieved by weakening the overactive mimic musculature in these areas. The fact that wrinkle treatment with injectable materials continues to grow despite the initial lowering of expectations is explained by the elegance of these procedures. There is no comparable method that enables an immediate, visible improvement of the outer appearance in a few minutes in a biological way, without any significant impairment of the patient.
The treatment with botulinum toxin leads to a temporary paralysis of the facial muscles and is mostly applied in the upper third of the face. Thus, the frown line region as well as the forehead region and crow's feet can be treated. In some cases, it is also indicated to work with very little Botox amounts in the area of the mouth or nose. We will explain to you exactly what effect this has on your face. The result lasts about 4-6 months.

sub.title: Hyaluronic acids
sub.content: Hyaluronic acids can be used to treat wrinkles as well as volume deficits in your face. The consistency of the hyaluronic acid varies depending on the region to be treated and the depth to which it is to be injected. We distinguish between very thin hyaluronic acids (e.g. for skin rejuvenating, treatment of the eye or treatment of the lips) and solid hyaluronic acids, which are mainly used to give volume in the area of the zygomatic arch. The hyaluronic acids also differ in their water-binding capacity depending on their firmness. A thin hyaluronic acid has less water-binding capacity than a firm one.

content.title: What do I have to consider before wrinkle treatments?
content.subtitle: Before the treatment with hyaluronic acid, you should not take any blood-thinning medication, such as painkillers. This is to prevent the increased formation of bruises. If you are in public life or have important appointments after the injections, it is recommended that the injections are carried out before a weekend. In this way, any small bruises can be reduced over the weekend. After an injection, you should not go to a sauna, do excessive exercise for 24-48 hours. After an injection with your own fat, the tendency to haematoma formation is usually more pronounced, so you should take 1-2 weeks off after this procedure.

content.title: When does wrinkle treatment make sense?
content.subtitle: Wrinkle treatment is already worthwhile when you notice the first signs of wrinkles or changes in your face. This is not age-dependent and can even lead to beautiful results before the age of 30. We can treat both static and dynamic wrinkles using either botulinum toxin (Botox) or hyaluronic acid. We will tell you which effect you can expect and for how long in a detailed consultation.

content.title: Is wrinkle treatment a classic cosmetic surgery procedure?
content.subtitle: Nowadays, wrinkle treatments are carried out by several specialties, including dermatologists. Wrinkle injections are a very popular treatment and are becoming more and more popular.

content.title: Who is allowed to carry out wrinkle treatments at all (doctor/cosmetician)?
content.subtitle: Wrinkle treatments with Botox as well as hyaluronic acid may only be carried out by licensed doctors of any speciality. These procedures should only be given to experienced hands. However, there are also cosmeticians on the market who perform these injections. You should rely on the respective experience of the practitioner as well as the feel-good factor and make your choice accordingly.

content.title: Can individual parts of the face and body be treated?
content.subtitle: Both individual parts of the face and body can be treated. Depending on the area and your wishes, it is important to choose the right preparation for the desired effect. We work with very high-quality partners and can therefore offer you high-quality products for any indication.

content.title: What kind of wrinkles can be treated?
content.subtitle:
Since wrinkles develop in different ways, it is advisable to treat them differently. Therefore, dynamic wrinkles in the area of the forehead and the frown line but also in the area of the crow's feet can be treated wonderfully with botulinum toxin. By blocking the neuromuscular transmission, the muscles responsible for the wrinkles are paralysed and thus the wrinkles are prevented from forming. Certainly, this also slightly changes your facial expression, e.g. depending on the area of application, you can no longer frown, look angry etc.. The effect wears off after 3-6 months and the wrinkles unfortunately come back.
 Other wrinkles (e.g. nasolabial folds) are caused by the sagging of various fat deposits in the cheek area. In this case, the wrinkles are injected multidimensionally. Based on our experience, we can make a recommendation during the consultation and treat you accordingly.

content.title: Do I really look younger and the skin firmer afterwards?
content.subtitle: Depending on the treatment and the materials used, the overall appearance will ideally look fresher. Our goal is to rejuvenate you naturally, so we place a lot of emphasis on professional injections with high-quality materials. Depending on your wishes and the extent of the existing wrinkles, several sessions may be necessary to achieve the desired result. We advise you in detail before each treatment and show you the possibilities with different preparations.

content.title: Will the wrinkles return?
content.subtitle: After the effect of Botox has worn off and the hyaluronic acid has also degraded, the wrinkles return in approximately the same form.

content.title: How often do wrinkle injections have to be performed?
content.subtitle: How often a treatment with appropriate materials has to be carried out depends very much on the patient's initial condition. For example, a young lady of 35 may only need one treatment a year with hyaluronic acid, while a lady of the same age or older may need multiple treatments. Certainly, the number of treatments also depends on the patient's financial possibilities. It is also possible to spread the planned treatments over a desired period of time and thus prolong the effect.

postTreatment.title: Aftercare
postTreatment.detail: Cooling immediately after treatment if necessary.

general.title: Allgemeines zur Lippenunterspritzung
general.content:
There is no area that is so much associated with sensuality, youthfulness, and eroticism as the lips. This is due to the fact that lips are rarely covered and are therefore the first thing to be noticed with the eyes when looking at the face.
Full lips in the sense of a kissing mouth appear attractive. Narrow lips, however, often give the impression of severity and doggedness.
The latest biotechnology now makes it possible to produce hyaluronic acids, which can be injected into the lips for contour and/or volume correction with little risk.

treatment.title: Die Behandlung
treatment.content: Most hyaluronic acid preparations used for lip injections contain a local anaesthetic so that only the injection is felt. If necessary, a local anaesthetic can be applied using anaesthetic ointment or a nerve block can be done by injection—as at the dentist.

content.title: What do I have to consider before the wrinkle injection?
content.subtitle: Before the treatment with hyaluronic acid, you should not take any blood-thinning medication, such as painkillers. This is to prevent the increased formation of bruises. If you are in public life or have important appointments after the injections, it is recommended that the injections are carried out before a weekend. This way, any small bruises can be reduced over the weekend. The visible swelling can last up to 7 days.

content.title: Who is suitable for lip injections?
content.subtitle: Lip injections are suitable for all women and men, regardless of age, who are dissatisfied with their lips. It can give your lips new volume and a natural and attractive shape.

content.title: What are lips injected with?
content.subtitle: Hyaluronic acid is a substance that is found in every skin cell. It stores water and leads to a smooth elastic skin texture. Cross-linked hyaluronic acid has established itself as the optimal filler for lips. Permanent fillers often cause problems and can lead to complications even after years. In recent years, scientific research in the field of fillers has led to a differentiation of fillers. Particularly soft flowable hyaluronic acids have been developed for the lips.

content.title: How long does the result of a lip injection last?
content.subtitle:
The durability of hyaluronic acid varies from person to person. An effect should be visible between 6-12 months.
The result is strongly dependent on the individual lifestyle (diet, smoking, alcohol consumption, sport, etc.).

content.title: How often can the treatment be repeated?
content.subtitle: A new treatment with hyaluronic acid should be carried out at least after 3 to 4 weeks, as the results of the first treatment are only fully visible after this time. Taking this period into consideration, the treatment with hyaluronic acid can be repeated as often as desired.

content.title: Is lip injection painful?
content.subtitle: The lip tissue is interwoven with numerous blood vessels and nerves and is a very sensitive region. Pain during the injection is caused by the increase in volume in the tissue. The tissue layers are pushed apart and a feeling of pressure on nerves and blood vessels develops. For this reason, most hyaluronic acid preparations used for lip injections contain a local anesthetic so that only the injection is felt. If necessary, a local anesthetic can also be applied using anesthetic ointment or a nerve block—as at the dentist.

content.title: What complications can arise?
content.subtitle: A lip injection, performed by an experienced specialist, is usually a procedure with few complications. Yet, infections, nodules and asymmetries can occur. However, this happens extremely rarely. Slight bruising, numbness and especially minor swelling following lip injections usually disappear after one to two days. Any asymmetries or nodules can be easily corrected with a Hylase injection. In this case, only the injected hyaluronic acid is dissolved. The bound hyaluronic acids of the body remain unaffected.

content.title: What should I pay attention to after lip injections?
content.subtitle: After lip injections, it is necessary to avoid touching the lips, as the filling materials will still be malleable for couple hours. Especially in the case of a lip injection with the patient's own fat, massaging the lips should be avoided. In addition, the lips will be extremely sensitive in the first few days after a lip injection. In case of slight swelling, the use of cooling pads is recommended.

anasthesia.title: Anaesthesia
anasthesia.detail: Anaesthesia with anaesthetic cream or nerve block.

general.title: Allgemeines zum Vampir-Lift
general.content:
The Vampire Lift (also known as PRP therapy or Platelet-Rich Plasma therapy) is a young procedure for gentle skin rejuvenation on the face, neck and décolleté. The treatment method was developed in the USA and quickly became popular there, especially among prominent actresses and singers. The procedure is called "vampire lift" because a small amount (approx. 20 ml) of the patient's own blood is taken for the treatment. From this own blood we obtain platelet-rich plasma, which is injected into the areas of skin to be regenerated. The platelet-rich plasma not only ensures tissue regeneration. Thanks to the growth factors it contains, it also promotes the formation of new cells.
You do not have to expect any side effects. This is because only the body's own filling material (blood plasma) is used for the treatment. Allergies and intolerance reactions can therefore be virtually ruled out. Unpleasant after-effects of the treatment can at most be expressed by slight swellings in the injection areas. However, these symptoms will disappear within a few days. Since the Vampire Lift does not require any skin incisions, the procedure does not leave any scar tissue. The growth factors contained in the blood plasma ensure lasting treatment success. Hair loss (alopecia) can also be treated with this method. The treatment is usually carried out 4 times at intervals of 4-6 weeks. 
We obtain the autologous blood required for the treatment from a suitable vein. The prepared blood plasma enters your subcutaneous tissue through fine needles and special techniques. Depending on the treatment objective, the plasma is injected in one or more layers.
The Vampire Lift takes about 20 minutes per treatment unit and is therefore comparatively time-consuming. Depending on the desired extent of treatment and the individual response to the measure, a Vampire Lift extends over 1 to 4 successive treatment units at intervals of 3 to 4 weeks.
Often, the visual treatment successes are already apparent a few days after the Vampire Lift. Since the procedure stimulates the formation of new cells, you usually benefit from the therapy in the long term.

treatment.title: Die Behandlung
treatment.content: First, blood is taken from a vein. The blood is then processed by centrifugation. The thrombocytes (blood platelets), in which the growth factors are stored, are isolated. These are then injected into the skin, as in mesotherapy. After the injection, the platelets release the growth factors into the tissue, which then control the process of skin regeneration.

content.title: What do I need to consider before the Vampire Lift?
content.subtitle: Please drink enough before the treatment. No blood thinning medication should be taken for one week prior to treatment. If you regularly take blood-thinning medication (ASS, Marcumar, Xarelto, etc.), please inform us in advance.

content.title: Is the Vampire Lift right for me?
content.subtitle: If you need a freshness boost or your skin looks tired and dull, the Vampire Lift is just right for you. Furthermore, plasma lifting is a very effective method against tired eyes and dull skin. All those who want to improve their appearance with natural methods without Botox and other means will find the right solution with this method. The autologous blood therapy is suitable for every skin type, every skin colour and every age. The result is absolutely natural.

content.title: Is PRP treatment painful?
content.subtitle: Before the plasma lift you will be anaesthetised with a special anaesthetic ointment in the facial area for about 30 minutes. During this time, blood will be taken from you and the blood will be prepared. The injection is done with microfine needles. The depth of the injection is usually less than two millimeters. The vampire lift is a gentle procedure. Most patients report small pinpricks and a burning sensation when the plasma is injected.

content.title: How long does the Vampire Lift take?
content.subtitle: We plan about 60 minutes for a PRP treatment. The pure treatment time usually does not exceed 20 minutes.

content.title: When can I expect visible results?
content.subtitle: Most patients report visible results after only 7 days. Patients often report a noticeable refreshment of the face. The final result after a treatment is achieved after about four weeks.

content.title: What should be considered after the PRP treatment?
content.subtitle: Immediately after the treatment there is a strong reddening and an enormous swelling of the face. This is even desirable and indicates the successful release of the growth factors. The redness is usually no longer visible within 4 hours after the treatment. The swelling usually persists slightly until the next day. Any bruising that may have occurred disappears after 7-14 days.

content.title: How long do the results last?
content.subtitle: After a single treatment, the results usually last about two months. If you do a course of 3 to 5 treatments, our patients report results lasting 6 to 12 months.

content.title: What do I need to be aware of after the Vampire Lift?
content.subtitle: After the treatment you should not exercise for 3 days, take a hot bath (showering is possible), do not use any acidic cosmetics and do not apply any facial masks. You should also avoid sunbathing and the solarium during this time.

content.title: Are there any side effects?
content.subtitle: The vampire lift is a gentle procedure in which only the body's own ingredients are used. Nevertheless, side effects can occur with any medical procedure. There are common side effects that you can expect after any injection. These are small bruises (increasingly rare due to the use of special needles), slight redness or swelling. These side effects subside on the same day, or after 1-2 days. Bruises can persist for up to two weeks. Especially if the injection is in the eye area. If bruises appear, you can cover them with hypoallergenic cosmetics. Very rare side effects would be skin surface infections, which can be treated with an antibiotic.

areasOfApplication.title: Areas of application
areasOfApplication.detail: Face | Neck | Head for hair loss

general.title: PRP-Therapie
general.content: The so-called PRP treatment is a particularly innovative and gentle method to prevent hair loss or to significantly improve already existing hair loss. It is a natural therapy against hair loss. During the treatment, the plasma is enriched with platelets from your own blood. The plasma isolated from your blood is rich in growth factors and platelets. Thrombocytes (blood platelets) are used in the body for blood clotting and are largely responsible for the healing process of skin damage or skin irritations. The isolated plasma is injected directly into your hair roots with very fine needles. The therapy increases the cell growth of your hair follicles.

treatment.title: Die Behandlung
treatment.content:
The method uses autologous blood plasma (PRP), which is injected specifically into the areas of the head with risk of hair loss. Through the natural extraction of the blood plasma and the platelets and growth factors it contains, existing hair can be strengthened, and dormant hair root cells can be reactivated.
As with a normal blood draw, a small amount of venous blood is taken from the patient's arm vein. The blood is processed in a centrifuge so that finally the platelet-rich plasma is separated and ready for injection. This is finally injected into the scalp.
Due to our minimally invasive injection technique, anesthesia of the scalp is not necessary.
The treatment takes between 60 and 90 minutes.

content.title: What should be considered before the procedure?
content.subtitle: One week before your autologous blood therapy, you should, if possible, refrain from taking certain medications. These include in particular medications such as aspirin, ibuprofen or other similar painkillers and rheumatism medications. It is very important to refrain from taking these medications because they inhibit the blood platelets (thrombocytes). You should not tone or color your hair for at least one week before the treatment.

content.title: Who is suitable for this therapy?
content.subtitle: The method is generally suitable for anyone who suffers from hair loss. It is often used against hair loss before and after a hair transplant. Through the treatment with the patient's own blood, the hair is stimulated and an improved growth of the hair follicles after the hair transplant can be achieved.

content.title: What are the advantages of PRP treatment for hair loss?
content.subtitle: PRP treatment for hair loss offers numerous advantages. First and foremost, the blood concentrate used in the treatment is made from your own blood. Thus, the procedure has very low risk. It is almost impossible for intolerances or allergic reactions to occur as a result of PRP therapy. With this method, a long-term treatment effect against hair loss can be achieved.

content.title: How often can PRP hair loss treatment be repeated?
content.subtitle: Depending on the cause of the hair loss, the PRP therapy should consist of about 6 individual PRP treatments, which are carried out at intervals of 3-4 weeks. If necessary, the therapy effect achieved should be refreshed with a single treatment every six months. In more than 90% of cases with acute hair loss, the hair loss improves after the first PRP treatment. No other therapy can currently achieve such successful results.

content.title: Does PRP hair loss treatment have side effects?
content.subtitle: Since PRP is a purely biological, autologous/body-own therapeutic agent without synthetic, chemical or other toxic substances, it is generally very well tolerated. Reactions in the form of allergies or other side effects are not known.

content.title: Is the PRP treatment against hair loss painful?
content.subtitle: Depending on the injection technique, PRP therapy can be experienced as painless to painful.

general.title: Allgemeines zur Anti-Stress Infusionstherapie
general.content:
Unser Alltag ist anspruchsvoll und stellt uns ständig vor neue Herausforderungen. In manchen Phasen müssen wir geistige und körperliche Höchstleistungen erbringen. Unsere Ressourcen werden zunehmend und oft schleichend aufgebraucht.
Die Power Infusion versorgt den Körper mit Nährstoffen in der richtigen Dosierung direkt über die Blutbahn und wird vom Körper zu 100% resorbiert. Vitamine, Mineralstoffe, Aminosäuren, Spurenelemente gelangen somit direkt dorthin, wo sie gebraucht werden.

treatment.title: Die Behandlung
treatment.content:
Die Infusionen unterliegen strengen wissenschaftlichen Erkenntnissen, und vor jeder Therapie findet eine individuelle Gesundheitsanalyse statt, um die Wirkstoffkombination individuell anzupassen.
Der speziell zusammengestellte Wirstoff-Cocktail wird intravenös mithilfe eines Katheters verabreicht. Die Behandlung ist bis auf den Pieks der Nadel völlig schmerzfrei und dauert ca. 45 Minuten bis 1,5 Stunden.
Mit einer einzigen Infusion erreichen Sie in kurzer Zeit einen zehnfachen Plasmaspiegel dessen, was Sie über die Nahrung oder Nahrungsergänzungsmittel aufnehmen können.
Für ein nachhaltiges Ergebnis empfehlen wir Kuren mit sechs bis zehn Behandlungen über drei bis fünf Wochen.

content.title: Für wen eignet sich eine Anti-Stress Infusion?
content.subtitle: Manager oder andere Personengruppen, die oft durch Dauerstress eine ungesunde Ernährung, wenig Schlaf und zu wenig Flüssigkeitsaufnahme an einem ausgeprägten Vitamin C Mangel leiden, sollen von diesem Trend profitieren. Durch die rehydrierenden und vitalisierenden Injektionen soll ein sanfter Energiekick induziert werden.

content.title: Wie viele Behandlungen werden benötigt?
content.subtitle: Für ein nachhaltiges Ergebnis empfehlen wir sechs bis zehn Behandlungen über drei bis fünf Wochen.

content.title: Wie lange wirken die Infusionen?
content.subtitle: Power-Infusion wirkt in Abhängigkeit des gewählten Kurplans 4 Wochen bis ? Monate.

content.title: Gibt es Nebenwirkungen?
content.subtitle:
Die Anti-Stress-Infusionen sind nahezu nebenwirkungsfrei.
Wie bei jeder Injektion, können im Bereich der Einstichstelle kleinere Schwellungen, Blutergüsse, Schmerzen, Juckreiz, Schwindel, Übelkeit und allergische Reaktionen auftreten.

general.title: Allgemeines zur Fett-Weg-Spritze
general.content:
The injection lipolysis is the controlled destruction of fat cells using medical substances. This procedure is a non-surgical treatment that is used especially for localised fat deposits. Injection lipolysis has been performed worldwide since 1995, it is therefore well proven and based on many years of experience.
The treatment with the the injection is particularly suitable for individual fat deposits that cannot be reduced by diet or exercise. Typical areas of application are the abdomen, hips, legs, double chin and the male breast. Compared to liposuction, in which fat cells are suctioned out in a surgical procedure, injection lipolysis is a smaller and more gentle procedure. However, the treatment is limited to smaller areas and does not work for every patient.

treatment.title: Die Behandlung
treatment.content:
The treatment is almost painless. Several sessions are usually necessary at intervals of about 4 to 6 weeks, the number of sessions depends on the fat deposits. The fat cells are completely destroyed, consequently the effect is permanent.
The treatment itself, which is carried out on an outpatient basis, takes about 15 to 45 minutes. First, the treatment area is marked and carefully disinfected afterwards. If necessary, you will be given a local anaesthetic in the form of a numbing cream on the affected parts of your body so that you do not feel the punctures.
After the treatment, you may experience redness and swelling around the injection site. Some patients report itching or tenderness at the site. However, these symptoms usually disappear within 2 to 7 days. In most cases, you can return to work the next day. However, as part of the aftercare, swimming pools, solariums, saunas and massages should be avoided for 7 days.

content.title: Who is suitable for injection lipolysis?
content.subtitle: The injection is a method that can be used as a supplement or alternative to liposuction. It is particularly suitable for the removal of smaller fat deposits in problem areas.

content.title: How does the injection lipolysis work?
content.subtitle:
There are different preparations that are used for injection lipolysis. The active ingredient common to all products is bile acid salts in different preparations. Another active ingredient of some preparations is phosphatidylcholine (lecithin from the soybean).
The effect of the injection is based on the principle of lipolysis, which is the name of the biochemical process of fat dissolution in the body's cells that first begins to soften the fat cover. The dissolved fats then enter the bloodstream via the lymphatic fluid, where they are removed and excreted in the stool. Unfortunately, there are some patients for whom this treatment method is unsuccessful.

content.title: Is the treatment painful?
content.subtitle: Patients only feel a slight burning sensation and some pressure sensitivity around the injection area. There may also be minor swelling and redness, which disappears after a short time.

content.title: What are the side effects?
content.subtitle: Injection lipolysis is a low-risk treatment. The substances used in this procedure have been used in medicine for decades. Thus, all side effects are generally known - these are limited to minimal swelling, redness, overheating in the injection area and increased sensitivity to pressure for a few days as well as possibly bruising, which, however, disappear quickly.

content.title: Is the result permanent?
content.subtitle: Yes, because the fat and the fat cells dissolve and are transported away via the lymphatic system. However, the human body has enough fat cells all over the body, so if you eat too much and exercise too little, the fat deposits may well reappear in the treated area.

content.title: What should I pay attention to after the treatment?
content.subtitle:
In the time after the treatment, you should wear comfortable clothing.
You should refrain from sauna and stronger sporting activities for 7 days, sun and solarium are also forbidden. The resorption of the fat cells in the problem zone is stimulated and the body purifies itself. Therefore, you should drink a lot after the treatment, this facilitates the flushing out of the unwanted substances. Alcohol impedes the reaction and therefore is absolutely forbidden.
